items.title: Is There Any Way to set timeout on jaydebeapi execute?
items.body:
conn = jaydebeapi.connect(
           conf_dict['jdbc_driver_class'],`
           conf_dict['jdbc_connection_string'],
           [db_id, db_pw],     
           conf_dict['jdbc_driver_library'] )

        logging.debug('CONNECT_SUCCESS!')
        cur = conn.cursor()
        logging.debug('BEFORE EXECUTE!')
        logging.debug('EXECUTE QUERY :: {}'.format(query))
        cur.execute(query)
        logging.debug('AFTER EXECUTE!')  <-- not printed

I always thanks for jaydebeapi.
above code is in my script
most time this script works well, but some big query doen'st work well
query execute never ends and the process of python script too.
so I want set timeout to execute, How can i set timeout on 'execute'?
thank you

items.title: Support "with" statement (PEP 343)
items.body:
Add support to use Connection and Cursor objects in the "with" statement
with jaydebeapi.connect( ... ) as conn:
    with conn.cursor() as cursor:
        # run some commands

I currently get an AttributeError: __enter__

The remedy is to add to Cursor and Connection classes __enter__ method and an __exit__ method which closes the resource.

items.title: Hive connectivity error - AttributeError: type object 'java.sql.Types' has no attribute '__javaclass__'
items.body:
I am trying to connect from Python to a hive DB. But I get the following error.

AttributeError: type object 'java.sql.Types' has no attribute '__javaclass__'

I am not fully sure if this is a bug, but I tried using the JDBC Uber Driver too and it didnt work.

I am using Open JDK 13, 
JayDeBeAPI version is 1.1.1
JPype1 version 0.7.2
Python version is 3.7.6
Hive JDBC Driver version is 3.1.2. downloaded from https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/hive/hive-jdbc/3.1.2/hive-jdbc-3.1.2.jar
OS is Amazon Linux on an EC2


Any help in letting me know if this is a bug, or if I am doing something wrong will be appreciated.

Here is the full code:

```bash
$ python
Python 3.7.6 (default, Feb 26 2020, 20:54:15)
[GCC 7.3.1 20180712 (Red Hat 7.3.1-6)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

>>> conn=jaydebeapi.connect("org.apache.hive.jdbc.HiveDriver", "jdbc:hive2://0.0.0.0:10000", [], "/home/airflow/hive-jdbc-3.1.2.jar")

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

this session. If you are a user of an application that reported this warning,
```

items.title: Incompatibility with JPype 0.7.2
items.body:
It seems that JayDeBeApi stopped to work after upgrading to JPype 0.7.2. When I try to connect to a database using the `jaydebeapi.connect` function, I get this error:

```
[...]
  File "/home/dqd/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/jaydebeapi/__init__.py", line 401, in connect
    jconn = _jdbc_connect(jclassname, url, driver_args, jars, libs)
  File "/home/dqd/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/jaydebeapi/__init__.py", line 198, in _jdbc_connect_jpype
    for i in types.__javaclass__.getClassFields():
AttributeError: type object 'java.sql.Types' has no attribute '__javaclass__'
```

When I downgrade to JPype 0.7.1, everything works correctly again.

items.title: Updates?
items.body:
I am very appreciative of JayDeBeApi, but is there any plan on releasing updates to Pypi?  Particularly, the fixes for Jpype v 0.7?

Theses issues are blocking a project I'm working on, and if there is anything I can do to assist, please let me know.

items.title: Non handled exception
items.body:
Symptom: raising an exception on line 151 of `__init__.py` of this package
> TypeError: issubclass() arg 1 must be a class

The exception is raised when running an erroneous SQL against a MySQL, MS SqlServer, or Oracle jdbc connection. I am running it in development with:

- Linux Mint 19.2 Tina
- openjdk version "1.8.0_222"
- Python 3.6.7, clean virtualenv 
- JPype1, version 0.7.0
- JayDeBeApi, version 1.1.2
- jdbc drivers: mysql-connector-java-5.1.39.jar, ojdbc8.jar, and  mssql-jdbc-6.3.5.jre8-preview.jar

  
The error is avoided if I change lite 151 of `__init__.py` 
from:
> `if issubclass(exc_info[1].__javaclass__, SQLException):`

into: 
> `if issubclass(exc_info[1].__class__, SQLException):`

In that case I get the expected SQL error, e.g., ORA-00942: table or view does not exist

If this is a know issue, please excuse me for bothering you.

items.title: Executemany with one parameter throws RuntimeError
items.body:
I'm trying to perform batch delete on DB2 database using Python and JayDeBeApi. 
When I try to call executemany() function with only one parameter I receive the following error: 
`RuntimeError: No matching overloads found for setObject in find. at native/common/jp_method.cpp:127`
Here's my Python code:
```
import jaydebeapi as jdbc
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

url = 'jdbc:db2://hostname:60010/DBNAME:sslConnection=true;sslTrustStoreLocation=javacerts.jks;'
user = 'username'
password = 'password'
jar_class = 'com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver'
jar_path = 'db2jcc4.jar'

df = pd.DataFrame(data={'KEYCOL1': [10395103, 12384099, 12845804, 13571847, 15971915]})

conn = jdbc.connect(jar_class, url, {'user': user, 'password': password}, jar_path)

cursor = conn.cursor()

sql = "DELETE FROM MYSCHEMA.MYTABLE WHERE KEYCOL1 = ?"

row_count = 0

for _, gdf in df.groupby(np.arange(len(df)) // 2000):
    tup_df = [tuple(x) for x in gdf.values]
    cursor.executemany(sql, tup_df)
    row_count = row_count + cursor.rowcount
    
print(str(row_count) + ' row(s) processed')
```
However, if I pass 2 or more params to executemany() it will work:
```
import jaydebeapi as jdbc
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

url = 'jdbc:db2://hostname:60010/DBNAME:sslConnection=true;sslTrustStoreLocation=javacerts.jks;'
user = 'username'
password = 'password'
jar_class = 'com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver'
jar_path = 'db2jcc4.jar'

df = pd.DataFrame(data={'KEYCOL1': [10395103, 12384099, 12845804, 13571847, 15971915], 'KEYCOL2': ['DCYFKR9F', 'DC1J9P4B', 'DC29X8L9', 'DC2J7KXB','DC3M7NSK']})

conn = jdbc.connect(jar_class, url, {'user': user, 'password': password}, jar_path)

cursor = conn.cursor()

sql = "DELETE FROM MYSCHEMA.MYTABLE WHERE KEYCOL1 = ? AND KEYCOL2 = ?"

row_count = 0

for _, gdf in df.groupby(np.arange(len(df)) // 2000):
    tup_df = [tuple(x) for x in gdf.values]
    cursor.executemany(sql, tup_df)
    row_count = row_count + cursor.rowcount

print(str(row_count) + ' row(s) processed')
```
Output:
`5 row(s) processed`
Using some workaround like "AND 1 = ?" didn't help (I assume this only works with existing columns)
I use Python 3.6.7, JayDeBeApi 1.1.1(latest) and JPype 0.6.3.
Has anyone else faced this issue? Any help will be appreciated.

items.title: Catch Netezza database errors
items.body:
I run sql commands on a Netezza db with Python using [JayDeBeApi](https://pypi.org/project/JayDeBeApi/). While inserting many records with a single insert command, validation errors by the database are passed in silence.

**Minimal example to reproduce**

Here is a sql table created with two columns (FAVCOLOR and NAME), the last record contains an integer instead of a string:

```python
import jaydebeapi

database_url = 'jdbc:netezza://NETEZZAIPADDRESS:5480/NZDATABASE'
jclassname='org.netezza.Driver'
username='MYUSERNAME'
password='MYPASSWORD'

sql = """
DROP TABLE MYSCHEMA.WEIRDPERSONS IF EXISTS;
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS MYSCHEMA.WEIRDPERSONS (FAVCOLOR VARCHAR(7), NAME VARCHAR(40));
INSERT INTO MYSCHEMA.WEIRDPERSONS (FAVCOLOR, NAME)
SELECT '#471934','Wayne Baker' UNION ALL
SELECT '#debf8e','Kenneth Holmes' UNION ALL
SELECT '#a921dd','Richard Taylor' UNION ALL
SELECT 1,'Linda Roberson';
"""

con = jaydebeapi.connect(
            jclassname=jclassname,
            url=database_url,
            driver_args=[username, password])
cursor = con.cursor()
cursor.execute(sql)
con.close()
```

The table will be empty since the insert command fails on validation.

**what I expect**

I expect the cursor execution to raise a Netezza DatabaseError

items.title: JayDeBeApi throws AttributeError: '_jpype.PyJPField' object has no attribute 'getStaticAttribute'
items.body:
![Screenshot 2019-06-25 at 12 59 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34773194/60093182-15766c00-9749-11e9-8c4a-8138877d563e.png)

This error is returned when JayDeBeApi is used with the latest version of JPype (0.7.0).
With the previous version of JPype (0.6.3) no problem.

We use JayDeBeApi in our Databricks environment which installs by default the latest JPype version. Overriding this with 0.6.3 version solves the problem.

items.title: Cannot connect via 2 different drivers at the same time
items.body:
Hi there, 

having this short code, everything works fine:
`import jaydebeapi`
`'''`
`conn0 = jaydebeapi.connect('org.postgresql.Driver',`
`                           ['jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/metadb','postgres','pwd'],`
`                           '../../resources/drivers/postgresql-42.1.3.jar')`
`'''`
`conn1 = jaydebeapi.connect('com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver',`
`                           ['jdbc:sqlserver://localhost:1433;databaseName=AdventureWorksDW2014',`
`                           'sa','Str0ngPassword!'], '../../resources/drivers/sqljdbc42.jar')`
`curs = conn1.cursor()`
`curs.execute('SELECT TOP 1 * FROM dbo.vDMPrep')`
`rs = curs.fetchall()`
`print(rs[0])`

The connection to MSSQL is successful as the output shows: 
>"C:\Program Files\Python37\python.exe" ../code/modules/test.py
>('Bikes', 'Road-150', 16616, 'Pacific', 33, 'High', 2011, 2010, 1, 'SO43746', 1, 1, 3578.27)
>Process finished with exit code 0 

But after adding the connection to Postgres (by removing the comment), Postgres works fine but MSSQL doesn't anymore: 

> 
>"C:\Program Files\Python37\python.exe" ../code/modules/test.py
>Traceback (most recent call last):
>  File "../code/modules/test.py", line 10, in <module>
>    '../../resources/drivers/sqljdbc42.jar')
>  File "C:\Program Files\Python37\lib\site-packages\jaydebeapi\__init__.py", line 68, in connect
>    connection = gateway.jvm.DriverManager.getConnection(*driver_args)
>  File "C:\Program Files\Python37\lib\site-packages\py4j\java_gateway.py", line 1257, in __call__
>    answer, self.gateway_client, self.target_id, self.name)
>  File "C:\Program Files\Python37\lib\site-packages\py4j\protocol.py", line 328, in get_return_value
>    format(target_id, ".", name), value)
>py4j.protocol.Py4JJavaError: An error occurred while calling z:java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection.
>: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc:sqlserver://localhost:1433;databaseName=AdventureWorksDW2014
>	at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(Unknown Source)
>	at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(Unknown Source)
>	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
>	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
>	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
>	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
>	at py4j.reflection.MethodInvoker.invoke(MethodInvoker.java:244)
>	at py4j.reflection.ReflectionEngine.invoke(ReflectionEngine.java:357)
>	at py4j.Gateway.invoke(Gateway.java:282)
>	at py4j.commands.AbstractCommand.invokeMethod(AbstractCommand.java:132)
>	at py4j.commands.CallCommand.execute(CallCommand.java:79)
>	at py4j.GatewayConnection.run(GatewayConnection.java:238)
>	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
>Process finished with exit code 1

I assume this is a general issue on managing 2 different JDBC drivers. 2 parallel connections to 2 different Postgres connections work perfectly fine, but with Exasol I experienced the same problem.

Similar to this issue: [https://github.com/baztian/jaydebeapi/issues/56](url)
Is there really no other way than by subprocess.call?

Cheers Kolja

items.title: Issue with Teradata SHOW SELECT * FROM SYNTAX
items.body:
# Background
Teradata SHOW SELECT * FROM syntax gives details of all Tables and Views Underlying the view which is being queried.  
  
For Example -  
If View Definition is  
```sql
CREATE VIEW ABC 
AS SELECT a.a, b.b, c.c
FROM a
INNER JOIN b
ON a.col = b.col
INNER JOIN c
ON b.col1 = c.col1;
```  
The output of 
```sql
SHOW SELECT * FROM ABC
```
would give definition of View ABC, Table a, Table b and table c.

# Problem Description
when querying SHOW SELECT * FROM ABC, the output does not have all definitions but it contains only 1 table definition whichever shows first. And does not return the definition of other tables and full view.

items.title: Error java.sql.SQLExceptionPyRaisable: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found
items.body:
Hello,
I have the following function to connect to a *Teradata* database:

```python
def fGetJDBCConnexion():
        oCipherKey = fGetParameter(pFileName='global_parameter.ini', pSectionName='AUDIT', pParameterName='oCipherKey').encode("UTF-8")
        oCipher = Fernet(oCipherKey)
        oPasswordEncrypted = fGetParameter(pFileName='global_parameter.ini', pSectionName='AUDIT', pParameterName='oPassword').encode("UTF-8")
        oPassword = oCipher.decrypt(oPasswordEncrypted).decode("UTF-8")

        # Retrieve audit database name and connexion string from global parameter file
        oDataBase = fGetParameter(pFileName='global_parameter.ini', pSectionName='AUDIT', pParameterName='oDataBase')
        oUserName = fGetParameter(pFileName='global_parameter.ini', pSectionName='AUDIT', pParameterName='oUserName')
        oConnexionString = fGetParameter(pFileName='global_parameter.ini', pSectionName='AUDIT', pParameterName='oConnexionStringJDBC')

        # Connect
        oConnexion = jaydebeapi.connect(
            'com.teradata.jdbc.TeraDriver',
            oConnexionString,
            {'user': oUserName, 'password': oPassword, 'tmode': 'TERA', 'charset': 'UTF8'},
            os.path.dirname(__file__) + '/teradataDriverJdbc.jar')
        return(oConnexion, oDataBase)
```

This function works well when doing unit tests. It returns both the connection object and my database name as expected.

However, this function is called as part of a bigger Flask API built with Flask-Restplus, and the function returns the following error message when it's executed in that context:

```
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ERROR in app [/home/alexis/dq/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask/app.py:1587]:
Exception on /dataqualityframework/api/v1/batchowners [GET]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/alexis/dq/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1639, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/home/alexis/dq/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1625, in dispatch_request
    return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args)
  File "/home/alexis/dq/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask_restplus/api.py", line 313, in wrapper
    resp = resource(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/alexis/dq/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask/views.py", line 84, in view
    return self.dispatch_request(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/alexis/dq/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flask_restplus/resource.py", line 44, in dispatch_request
    resp = meth(*args, **kwargs)
  File "api.py", line 152, in get
    oStatus, oBatchOwners = batch_owner.fGetBatchOwner()
  File "/home/alexis/data-quality/api/batch_owner.py", line 125, in fGetBatchOwner
    oData = fGetBatchOwnerData()
  File "/home/alexis/data-quality/api/batch_owner.py", line 107, in fGetBatchOwnerData
    oConnexion, oQueryParameter['DATABASE'] = global_function_api.fGetJDBCConnexion()
  File "/home/alexis/data-quality/api/global_function_api.py", line 133, in fGetJDBCConnexion
    os.path.dirname(__file__) + '/teradataDriverJdbc.jar')
  File "/home/alexis/dq/lib/python3.5/site-packages/jaydebeapi/__init__.py", line 381, in connect
    jconn = _jdbc_connect(jclassname, url, driver_args, jars, libs)
  File "/home/alexis/dq/lib/python3.5/site-packages/jaydebeapi/__init__.py", line 199, in _jdbc_connect_jpype
    return jpype.java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(url, *dargs)
jpype._jexception.java.sql.SQLExceptionPyRaisable: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc:teradata://server-name.company.org
```

Would you please have any idea why and how to solve this issue?
Thanks

items.title: Super slow SQL pulls against Teradata
items.body:
My SQL queries are extremely slow against Teradata. So for example, a sample SQL pull takes 5 seconds with SQL Assistant or with R (using JDBC, the same driver that I use). The same pull takes about 10 times as long with this:

# ============================
import jaydebeapi as jdb
jclassname = 'com.teradata.jdbc.TeraDriver'
SERVER = '...'  # I know this is set correctly. 
t_url = "jdbc:teradata://" + SERVER
user = "..."
passwd = "..."
sql = "...."

conn = jdb.connect(jclassname=jclassname, url=t_url, driver_args=[user, passwd])
cursor = conn.cursor()
cursor.execute(sql)
dat = cursor.fetchall()
# =============================

It runs fine, but this will take about 40-50 seconds. I've tried everything, from using fetchone() instead of fetchall(), to changing the cursor.arraysize etc., but it's still extremely slow. I know the .jar files are fine, as R uses them to pull the same data in 5 seconds. Any ideas?

(I'm using Python 2.7.14, 64 bit and jaydebeapi 1.1.1)

items.title: JDBC driver which does not support "prepared Statement"
items.body: From [issue 11](https://github.com/baztian/jaydebeapi/issues/11), I know every SQL statement passed from  jaydebeapi **is executed using a prepared statement**. Is there any way to pass a SQL statement to a JDBC driver which does not support *prepared Statement*?

items.body:
Hello,

today on fresh Windows 2012 R2 Standart I installed JVM 8u131 x64 и x86 + python-3.6.1-amd64. I have script by Python for connect to Oracle by JDBC.

```
import jaydebeapi
import jpype

conn = jaydebeapi.connect("oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver",
                          "jdbc:oracle:thin:@(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS_LIST=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=host01)(PORT=1111)))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVICE_NAME=oracle1)))",
                          ["user", "password"],
                          "c:\\Server\\Tomcat\\webapps\\um\\WEB-INF\\lib\\ojdbc7.jar",)
curs = conn.cursor()
curs.execute("select sysdate from dual")
results = curs.fetchall()
if results:
    for r in results:

curs.close()
conn.close()
```

items.title: Disabling local execution of query syntax
items.body:
My issue is the syntax of my database is non-standard, and I am having issue executing a pass-through statement to avoid what I suspect is some sort of query checking prior to sending to the server.  I want to disable that, but getting an error when I execute the following:

```
SET PASSTHROUGH nedbprod TRUE;

select
  site.segment_site
  ,site.user_tag_ident as site_ident
  ,site.name as site_name
  ,turbine.user_tag_ident as asset_ident
  ,turbine.name as asset_name
  ,turbine.segment_id as turbine_seg_id
  from nedbprod.<...>.segment site
    join nedbprod.<...>.segment_child t_sc 
    on (site.segment_id = t_sc.segment_id 
    and site.segment_site = t_sc.segment_site 
    and t_sc.rstat_type_code = 1)
    join nedbprod.<...>.segment turbine
    on (turbine.segment_id = t_sc.child_sg_id 
    and t_sc.segment_site = turbine.segment_site)
  where turbine.sg_type_code = 637;

SET PASSTHROUGH nedbprod FALSE;
```

**Output**

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorExceptionPyRaisableTraceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-39-c15641c98f44> in <module>()
     85 
     86 if __name__ == "__main__":
---> 87     turb_seg_map = main(q_obj_list)
     88 
     89 # convert to json

<ipython-input-39-c15641c98f44> in main(query_obj_list)
     80                                    [cirroURL, cirroUser, cirroPw],
     81                                    cirroJarLoc,)
---> 82     [mapping.update(cirro_query_wrapper(cirroConn, x)) for x in query_obj_list]
     83     cirroConn.close()
     84     return mapping

<ipython-input-39-c15641c98f44> in cirro_query_wrapper(conn, query_dict)
     22     passthrough_e = 'SET PASSTHROUGH ' + query_dict['db_name'] + ' FALSE;'
     23     print passthrough_s + q + '\n' + passthrough_e
---> 24     s = conn.jconn.prepareStatement(passthrough_s + q + '\n' + passthrough_e)
     25     curs.execute(s)
     26     data = curs.fetchall()

java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorExceptionPyRaisable: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: Syntax error: Encountered "nedbprod" at line 1, column 17.
```

items.title: IBM DB2Driver not found
items.body:
I am trying this in my Python notebook in Jupyter 3.0 and unfortunately, it always complains that an error like :  

``` shell
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
java.lang.RuntimeExceptionPyRaisable      Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-5-b9bc6451129e> in <module>()
----> 1 idadb=IdaDataBase(dsn=connection_string)

/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/ibmdbpy/base.pyc in __init__(self, dsn, uid, pwd, autocommit, verbose)
    239 
    240             try:
--> 241                 self._con = jaydebeapi.connect('com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver', self._connection_string)
    242             except:
    243                 raise

/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/jaydebeapi/__init__.pyc in connect(jclassname, driver_args, jars, libs)
    357     else:
    358         libs = []
--> 359     jconn = _jdbc_connect(jclassname, jars, libs, *driver_args)
    360     return Connection(jconn, _converters)
    361 

/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/jaydebeapi/__init__.pyc in _jdbc_connect_jpype(jclassname, jars, libs, *driver_args)
    180             return jpype.JArray(jpype.JByte, 1)(data)
    181     # register driver for DriverManager
--> 182     jpype.JClass(jclassname)
    183     return jpype.java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(*driver_args)
    184 

/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/jpype/_jclass.pyc in JClass(name)
     53     jc = _jpype.findClass(name)
     54     if jc is None:
---> 55         raise _RUNTIMEEXCEPTION.PYEXC("Class %s not found" % name)
     56 
     57     return _getClassFor(jc)

java.lang.RuntimeExceptionPyRaisable: java.lang.RuntimeException: Class com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver not found
```

Here is my source code:

``` shell
import jaydebeapi
from ibmdbpy import IdaDataBase
connection_string="jdbc:db2://awh-yp-small03.services.dal.bluemix.net:50000/BLUDB:user=dash104434;password=xxxxxx;;"
idadb=IdaDataBase(dsn=connection_string)
```

It seems like that JayDeBeApi has problem to retrieve DB2 driver class, however, this jar file is actually  in presence at **'/usr/local/lib/db2jcc4.jar'**.

However, if I manually inject a line of "**jaydebeapi.connect('com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver', connection_string,'/usr/local/lib/db2jcc4.jar')**"  like the below, everything works fine : 

``` shell
import jaydebeapi
from ibmdbpy import IdaDataBase
connection_string="jdbc:db2://awh-yp-small03.services.dal.bluemix.net:50000/BLUDB:user=dash104434;password=xxxxxx;;"
jaydebeapi.connect('com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver', connection_string,'/usr/local/lib/db2jcc4.jar')
idadb=IdaDataBase(dsn=connection_string)
```

I am just wondering why db2 driver can't be recognized by default unless I explicitly invoke **jaydebeapi.connect()** function. Why ?

Error reported as 
running build_ext
building '_jpype' extension
error: Microsoft Visual C++ 10.0 is required (unable to find vcvarsall.bat)

Is there a binary available for Windows? Or do you have some advice on getting through this error?

Thanks.
George

items.title: Incorrect datetime as str
items.body:
I'm interacting with snowflake computing database using python connecting via jaydebeapi and the JDBC driver.

In the database I have a TIMESTAMP_LTZ(9) field containing Sat, 01 Nov 2014 07:49:46 -0700 which is localized to a python str  '2014-11-01 10:45:49'  which is Eastern Timezone, time zone my computer is in.  

Is this date getting localized to EST in jaydebeapi? Secondly, is that where it's getting flattened to a string?

items.title: support for UCanAccess
items.body:
[UCanAccess](http://ucanaccess.sourceforge.net/site.html) is a open source Java JDBC Driver implementation to allow clients read/write on  MSAccess files (`*.mdb`, `*.accdb`)

Since it's a JDBC driver, I thought I'd try it with jaydebeapi.  I tried it out, and was really explicit with jar locations, but it doesn't seem to be working. FWIW I also tried this with `JAVA_HOME` set to `/usr/lib/jvm/java-7-oracle` and `/usr/lib/jvm/java-7-openjdk-amd64`.

items.title: works with Teradata Aster
items.body:
Hi, I just wanted to let you know that jaydebeapi works fine for me with Aster. I'm using Aster Express virtual machines and connect from Python3 on Windows 7. Thank you for your work on jaydebeapi!

If you are interested in the code I use, I paste it in the following:

```
import jpype,jaydebeapi

def connectExpress(database='beehive',user='beehive',password='beehive'):
    # from TD Studio Default Driver definition
    jclassname='com.asterdata.ncluster.Driver'
    # from TD Studio jdbc:<subprotocol>://<server>:<port>/<database>
    url='jdbc:ncluster://192.168.100.100:2406/'+database
    # driver args contains the arguments passed to java: DriverManager.getConnections(...)
    # see http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/DriverManager.html#getConnection(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String)
    driver_args=[url,user,password]
    # jar: use it as argument in jpype.startJVM
    asterjar='C:/Program Files/Teradata/clients-win64/noarch-aster-jdbc-driver.jar'
    jvmstartargs='-Djava.class.path='+asterjar

    # start JVM if not running yet (in the 64bit version the client JVM was removed, so use the server JVM instead)
    if not jpype.isJVMStarted():
        jpype.startJVM(r'C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\server\jvm.dll',jvmstartargs)
    # establish connection
    return jaydebeapi.connect(jclassname,driver_args)
```

items.title: JayDeBeApi works with Mimer
items.body:
Hi, FYI jaydebeapi works perfectly with Mimer DB version 10.0.7c running on OpenVMS 8.3.

```
>>> jar = 'mimjdbc3.jar'
>>> args='-Djava.class.path=%s' % jar
>>> jvm = jpype.getDefaultJVMPath()
>>> jpype.startJVM(jvm, args)
>>> conn = jaydebeapi.connect('com.mimer.jdbc.Driver', ['jdbc:mimer://my_server:1360/MY_DB', 'USER', 'PASSWORD'])
```

Cheers

items.title: Jaydebe makes first call but always errors on following
items.body:
I am running a Django 1.8.2 application on OSX,  trying to use the Jaydebeapi in order to query an IBM DB2 instance.

The first query will always work without a hitch but any following queries bomb with an error and I must restart Pycharm for it to work again.

conn = jaydebeapi.connect('com.ibm.as400.access.AS400JDBCDriver', ['jdbc:as400://TMCAS400:446', 'USERNAME', 'PASSWORD'], ['/Users/jassenmichaels/Library/Preferences/PyCharm40/jdbc-drivers/jt400.jar', '/Users/jassenmichaels/Library/Preferences/PyCharm40/jdbc-drivers/jtopen-driver-license.txt'])

ERROR:
<bound method java.sql.SQLExceptionPyRaisable.message of SQLExceptionPyRaisable(<jpype._jclass.java.sql.SQLException object at 0x10b3b54d0>,)> is not JSON serializable

I am using the same jars and config that PyCharm is using in its internal DB tools which work without issue and I can browse / query against this instance.

Any ideas on what I may be doing wrong?

items.title: Improve support for DB types
items.body:
https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-db/issues/3 outlined a soultion for a more clever conversion of types. regis1512 is not using getObject. He uses getDate/getTime/getTimestamp depending on the java.sql.Type. This fixes the issues with Oracle's date. It could also be used for other types.

If I'm at it: Implement a mapping for BIGINT (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26899595/jpype-and-jaydebeapi-returns-jpype-jclass-java-lang-long)

items.title: Problem creating two connections
items.body:
I am struggling to create two connections in a single python program.  My use case is that I want to connect to a source database and a target database to move data around.  My single program requires both connections to be live at the same time. I am trying to run this code in Python 2.7.5:

```
    import jaydebeapi as jdbc

    ct = jdbc.connect('com.teradata.jdbc.TeraDriver',
                     ['jdbc:teradata://vivaldi.vip.ebay.com', getpass.getuser(), p[0]],
                     ['/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.1/Resources/library/ebaytd/terajdbc4.jar',
                      '/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.1/Resources/library/ebaytd/tdgssconfig.jar'],)

    cm = jdbc.connect('com.mysql.jdbc.Driver',
                    ['jdbc:mysql://10.9.250.213:3306','root',p[0]],
                    ['/Users/magardner/Documents/Development/R/mysqljdbc/mysql-connector-java-5.1.33-bin.jar'],)
```

I get an error when the second call to jdbc.connect is made:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/magardner/PycharmProjects/ebayep-backend/process.py", line 82, in <module>
    main()
  File "/Users/magardner/PycharmProjects/ebayep-backend/process.py", line 61, in main
    ['/Users/magardner/Documents/Development/R/mysqljdbc/mysql-connector-java-5.1.33-bin.jar'],)
  File "/Users/magardner/untitled/lib/python2.7/site-packages/jaydebeapi/dbapi2.py", line 269, in connect
    jconn = _jdbc_connect(jclassname, jars, libs, *driver_args)
  File "/Users/magardner/untitled/lib/python2.7/site-packages/jaydebeapi/dbapi2.py", line 116, in _jdbc_connect_jpype
    jpype.JClass(jclassname)
  File "/Users/magardner/untitled/lib/python2.7/site-packages/jpype/_jclass.py", line 58, in JClass
    raise _RUNTIMEEXCEPTION.PYEXC("Class %s not found" % name)
jpype._jexception.RuntimeExceptionPyRaisable: java.lang.RuntimeException: Class com.mysql.jdbc.Driver not found
```

However if I comment out _either_ of the jdbc.connect statements each runs successfully on it's own and allows me to connect to the relevant database.  If I reverse the order of the jdbc.connect statements I still get the error on the second call.

I think this may have something to do with the way that JPype is being reused in the second call.  Is this something I am doing wrong?  Or is there a known issue here? 

Thanks in advance for any suggestions,
Matt
